title: Chess Bot
tagline: Semantic search for photography portfolio using ML embeddings
description:
Built a sophisticated search system for my photography portfolio that understands natural language queries. Uses Xenova's multilingual-e5-small model to generate embeddings for photos, combining semantic search with BM25 keyword matching through reciprocal rank fusion.

The system processes metadata (location, tags, camera settings) into searchable vectors, allowing queries like 'sunset beaches' or 'urban architecture' to find relevant photos beyond simple keyword matching. Implemented client-side for instant results with no backend dependencies.

Key technical challenges included optimizing embedding generation for ~1000 photos, implementing efficient cosine similarity search in the browser, and balancing semantic vs keyword relevance through tuned RRF weights.

title: 3D Blackjack Game
tagline: A 3D blackjack game built with React, TypeScript, Three.js, and Zustand.
description:
Developed a fully interactive 3D blackjack game featuring realistic card physics and smooth animations powered by React Three Fiber and React Spring. Implements complete blackjack game logic with automatic dealer AI that follows casino rules (hits on <17), proper scoring with ace value handling, and win/loss detection.

Built with a modular architecture separating game logic (deck creation, shuffling, scoring rules) from rendering concerns. Uses Zustand for predictable state management, enabling clean separation between game state and 3D scene updates. Features physics-based card animations with realistic flip transitions and hand positioning.

Key technical achievements include optimized 3D rendering for smooth 60fps gameplay, custom 3D UNC-themed card components with proper lighting and shadows, and a responsive UI overlay that doesn't interfere with scene interactions. Built for Claude Builder's Club Mini Hackathon, winning 3rd Place.

title: Good Studio
tagline: AI-powered microsite builder for small nonprofits and community organizations.
description:
Engineered an AI-powered website builder that generates complete, accessible microsites for nonprofits in under 2 minutes using a sophisticated 4-agent pipeline powered by Google Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite. The system orchestrates Brand, Copywriter, Accessibility, and Developer agents using LangGraph, with real Server-Sent Events streaming progress to the frontend (not simulated delays).

Implemented a robust visual site editor with a drag-and-drop block system supporting text, images, and flex layouts. Features inline content editing, live preview updates, and AI-powered content regeneration with adjustable tone and audience targeting. Built an event management system with RSVP functionality, capacity tracking, email validation, and IP-based rate limiting to prevent spam.

Architected with multi-tenant security using Supabase Row Level Security policies for data isolation. Includes comprehensive error handling with deterministic AI fallbacks that never crash the generation pipeline: if the AI fails, production-quality fallback data is used instead. Built for HackNC 2025, winning Best Use of Gemini API.

title: Rescored
tagline: Convert YouTube videos into editable sheet music using AI.
description:
Created a recipe management application that helps users organize recipes, plan meals, and generate shopping lists. Uses AI to suggest recipes based on available ingredients and dietary preferences.

Built with Next.js and MongoDB for flexible recipe storage. The AI meal planner uses GPT-4 to generate weekly meal plans considering nutritional balance, ingredient overlap to minimize waste, and user preferences.

Features include recipe import from URLs with automatic parsing, nutritional information calculation, serving size adjustment, and ingredient substitution suggestions. Mobile-responsive design optimized for kitchen use.

title: Bible RAG
tagline: Multilingual Bible study platform powered by semantic search and RAG.
description:
Developed Bible RAG, a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system for intelligent Bible study supporting English and Korean with deep integration of original biblical languages (Hebrew, Greek, Aramaic). Features natural language semantic search across 10+ translations including NIV, ESV, KJV, 개역한글, and 새번역.

Built using FastAPI, PostgreSQL with pgvector for vector similarity search, and Next.js 15 with TypeScript. Integrated the multilingual-e5-large embedding model (1024-dim) for semantic search and Google Gemini 2.5 Flash API for contextual LLM responses with Groq fallback.

Ingested 442,413 original language words with Strong's Concordance numbers (99.9% Greek coverage, 98.1% Hebrew coverage, 98.0% Aramaic coverage) providing morphological parsing, transliteration, and interlinear word-by-word analysis. Implemented Redis caching layer achieving <500ms response times for cached queries and <2s for initial searches. Features parallel translation view, cross-reference discovery with 63,779+ verse connections, Korean-specific typography with Hanja display, and automatic query intent detection with code-switching support.

title: Vault
tagline: Personal desktop app for analyzing credit card spending patterns.
description:
Engineered Vault, a privacy-first personal finance desktop application for analyzing credit card spending patterns and optimizing rewards. Designed with a local-only philosophy, ensuring financial data is stored securely in a local SQLite database with zero cloud dependencies or data sharing.

Built using Next.js 15, Electron, and TypeScript to deliver a high-performance desktop experience. Integrated the Google Gemini 2.5 Flash API to perform intelligent batch categorization of transactions and implemented a Jaro-Winkler fuzzy matching algorithm for advanced vendor name normalization and bulk updates.

Features a sophisticated data ingestion pipeline capable of parsing CSV, XLSX, and PDF formats with automatic column mapping and duplicate detection. Includes dynamic spending analytics visualized through Recharts, multi-currency support for 12 global currencies, and comprehensive export capabilities for HTML and CSV reporting.

title: Smart Charge
tagline: A native macOS menu bar application for battery health.
description:
Developed a native macOS menu bar application that implements intelligent battery charging algorithms to maximize battery lifespan while ensuring device availability.  Features real-time power monitoring, customizable charging rules, and beautiful visualizations of system energy flow with an "Availability First" philosophy.

Built with Swift and SwiftUI for a lightweight, fast, macOS-native experience. Implements three charging modes: Availability (prioritizes readiness), Longevity (optimizes battery health), and Custom (user-defined rules). Features deterministic time-based and power-draw logic for predictable behavior, avoiding complex pattern learning black boxes.

Key technical achievements include integration with macOS System Management Controller (SMC) for hardware-level charging control via the battery CLI tool, privileged helper implementation for real-time CPU/GPU power metrics monitoring using powermetrics, and comprehensive documentation covering architecture, data flows, and development workflows.  Provides manual control with smart defaults, giving users full transparency and control over charging behavior.

title: Nebula
tagline: Wasserstein GAN for generating realistic nebula images.
description:
A deep learning project implementing a Wasserstein Generative Adversarial Network (WGAN) to generate synthetic nebula images that capture the complex textures and color gradients of astrophotography. Trained on a curated dataset of real nebula images from Kaggle, exploring how GANs can learn to reproduce natural cosmic phenomena.

Developed a progressive training pipeline supporting multiple image resolutions (64px through 512px) to balance training stability with output quality. Implemented Wasserstein loss with gradient penalty to address mode collapse issues common in standard GANs. Includes comprehensive experimentation notebooks documenting training curves, generated sample evolution, and discriminator performance metrics.

Features modular architecture with separate training, generation, and testing scripts for reproducible experiments. The discriminator test utility enables quantitative evaluation of generated images versus real samples. Demonstrates practical applications of GANs beyond traditional use cases, showing how generative models can learn complex natural patterns from limited training data. Documented in a Medium blog post exploring the intersection of machine learning and astrophotography.

title: GraphSense
description:
Built an intelligent data visualization platform that automatically analyzes datasets and recommends optimal visualizations using a 3-agent AI pipeline powered by Google Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite. The Enhanced Data Profiler performs comprehensive statistical analysis and correlation detection, the Chart Recommender evaluates all 10 supported chart types with confidence scoring, and the Validation Agent refines recommendations with quality assessment and appropriateness validation.

Engineered an advanced infinite canvas system with viewport-aware chart placement, ensuring new visualizations always appear in the user's current view. Implemented a precision coordinate system with smooth zoom (0.1x-5x) and pan controls, integrated with a smart minimap providing 1:1 positional accuracy and instant navigation. Features anti-stacking intelligence with random offsets to prevent chart overlap on creation.

Supports 10 chart types (Bar, Line, Scatter, Pie, Histogram, Box Plot, Heatmap, Area, Treemap, Sankey) with automatic axis field detection and data mapping. Optimized for performance with data sampling for large datasets, memoized rendering, and RAF-throttled updates. Includes real-time system monitoring with backend health checks, connection status indicators, and detailed diagnostics (response times, CPU/memory usage). Processes complete datasets in 20-40 seconds with transparent AI reasoning for all recommendations. Built for VTHacks 2025, winning Best Auto Visualization Agent.

title: ML Drift Detection Learning Project
tagline: Interactive exploration of statistical drift detection for production ML monitoring.
description:
A hands-on learning project exploring statistical drift detection for production ML systems using the UCI Bike Sharing Dataset. Demonstrates when drift detection works, when it fails, and how to combine it with performance-based monitoring.

Includes four Jupyter notebooks covering data exploration, natural drift analysis (63% ridership increase between 2011-2012), synthetic experiments, and a 2×2 detection matrix for diagnosing drift types. Implements Population Stability Index (PSI) to measure distribution shifts across features.

Features an interactive Next.js web interface with D3.js visualizations for exploring drift detection concepts without requiring Python. Includes animated histograms, real-time PSI gauges, an interactive drift simulator, and step-by-step explainer pages. Demonstrates three key insights: PSI alone is insufficient, feature importance matters, and combining statistical and performance metrics is essential for robust monitoring.

title: Personal Portfolio Website
tagline: Modern portfolio showcasing photography and development work.
description:
Designed and built this portfolio website to showcase my photography and development projects. Features a clean, minimal design with smooth animations and transitions that enhance the user experience without overwhelming content.

Implemented with Next.js for optimal performance with static site generation and image optimization. Uses anime.js for scroll-triggered animations and Intersection Observer for lazy loading. Achieved 100/100 Lighthouse scores across all metrics.

Includes advanced features like AI-powered search, interactive tech visualizations, and adaptive layouts that work seamlessly across devices. Built with accessibility in mind, supporting keyboard navigation and respecting user motion preferences.
